Don't remove the template, which indicates you should update `changes.md`.
Also, if you want to activate this, you should add this file to the activated in the application.yml.

Yes, I just added that

Which document? I didn't notice that too.

Could you share the link here? I can't follow your point.
This is all I can see about the changes.

> Don't remove the template, which indicates you should update `changes.md`.

OKÔºå I will change it

> > > This is all I can see about the changes. Sorry, I mean this, maybe it should not be called "pr docs"? And I will change there words follow the pr template ![example image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34618178/192995386-0ab937db-9ba3-4a3e-b7fc-65f1420fd96b.png)

No, that is not docs. And there is no PR's docs thing. 

This is the [official doc](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/#SkyWalking), which is built from [here](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/README.md) from the latest to every selected version.

What you wrote here is called the content or description of this PR. The purpose of this is to introduce what you changed and why you changed in the way. You should write what you had written here, that is good practice. Just it isn't being called a doc.

> No, that is not docs. And there is no PR's docs thing.
> 
> This is the [official doc](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/#SkyWalking), which is built from [here](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/README.md) from the latest to every selected version.
> 
> What you wrote here is called the content or description of this PR. The purpose of this is to introduce what you changed and why you changed in the way. You should write what you had written here, that is good practice. Just it isn't being called a doc.

Thank you for your correctionÔºÅ

Please put a better format of your issue.
1. Correct title.
2. Don't repeat things in the template, just put the current steps and description.
Closing for now, as no more questions to discuss.
We can't reproduce this on the demo and local env. I would say most likely this is a fixed bug in old releases.
why is Missing configuration? or How to do ?

Why a 404 should be a bug? This is clearly you don't send requests to the right place.

Also, if you are using postman rather than the agent, it is your responsibility to understand the protocol, and report correctly.

> Why a 404 should be a bug? This is clearly you don't send requests to the right place.
> 
> Also, if you are using postman rather than the agent, it is your responsibility to understand the protocol, and report correctly.

It is not bug, I was just asking what I should doÔºüIt has been accessed according to skywalking-client-js, but now it reponse 404
![‰ºÅ‰∏öÂæÆ‰ø°Êà™Âõæ_3cc9ede0-86bc-44be-99d6-ab3fd70e376e](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69246580/193239939-becfe122-cc7f-41a8-a171-46c1777cdbac.png)
![‰ºÅ‰∏öÂæÆ‰ø°Êà™Âõæ_53412481-385e-45f6-af66-2d010f6c4562](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69246580/193239978-c8f41a83-7350-4f53-a440-8ab263da9006.png)

Sorry, that is your env, we don't have a special configuration to respond 404 on purpose. 
OAP don't know if it is from the client agent or your postman. The only reason is you are sending the request to the wrong place.

> http://xxxxxx:12800/browser/perfData



> Sorry, that is your env, we don't have a special configuration to respond 404 on purpose. OAP don't know if it is from the client agent or your postman. The only reason is you are sending the request to the wrong place.

You mean the configured address http://xxxxxx:12800 incorrect? But this is the oap server address, and the others are encapsulated in skywalking-client-js
How could I know? If the agent is correct, you should be able to know where to send easily.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193243750-fc79d321-869b-40a2-bfbc-74d3b67733c8.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193243591-3e4b3121-b163-43f9-94ea-31e8aa0ba951.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193243610-55e5e139-648d-40f2-9a2a-1e4d9cefe760.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193243633-2dbcc8f4-f339-4749-bf4f-dff707a35fd8.png)

How about the layout?

APISIX's Prometheus supports Endpoint level metrics? Is that path routing rule path? Or is it really access URI? Which could be thousands easily.
Notice, this is a pure question, it isn't SkyWalking's concern.

> How could I know? If the agent is correct, you should be able to know where to send easily.

It's OK to collect Java information from the same address through the agent, then change the port to 12800, and skywalking client js reports this error after configuration. So what's the problem?

https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-showcase/next/readme/

Showcase is there for you to set features out of box on k8s or docker compose. We wouldn't debug for your env, we can't afford that cost.

The  metrics which contains  route , node face to specific node(or upstream ), else other to  all node 
```
# HELP apisix_bandwidth Total bandwidth in bytes consumed per service in APISIX
# TYPE apisix_bandwidth counter
apisix_bandwidth{type="egress",route="",service="",consumer="",node=""} 678
apisix_bandwidth{type="egress",route="routes#1",service="1",consumer="",node="127.0.0.1"} 678
apisix_bandwidth{type="ingress",route="",service="",consumer="",node=""} 627
apisix_bandwidth{type="ingress",route="routes#1",service="1",consumer="",node="127.0.0.1"} 252
```
If we only collect metrics from apisix aspect (skip metrics which don't contain `route` ,`node` ) , the result  would be incomplete .
If group metrics by  `type ` `route `  `node ` , the metrics  label would be too many , the number would be `typeNumer*routeNumber*nodeNumer `
So  I map node to instance , route to endpoint .


> Is that path routing rule path

Is route path(or  route id ) , isn't  really access path , like 
```yaml 
routes:
    -
# route 1
        uri: /self/*
        service_id: 1
services:
    -
        id: 1
        upstream_id: 2
upstreams:
    -
        id: 2
        nodes:
            "127.0.0.1:9080": 1
        type: roundrobin        

```

What is your question to discuss?

Once endpoints are only rules, I am good.
could I work on this?

> could I work on this?

Yes thanks!

I think it is OK.
In the default prometheus metrics template of `APISIX`, metrics labels such as `route` and `node` will indeed lead to a surge in the number of metrics. 
I think it is OK to map `node` to `instance` or  `route` to `endpoint`. The only downside is that you need to click it layer by layer.
Thanks, and yes, I think these two mappings make sense.
Also, you need to sync with the master branch, and resolve conflicts.(just a changelog doc)

> 



> Also, you need to sync with the master branch, and resolve conflicts.(just a changelog doc)

OK
Thanks for reporting. I see the problem.

PS - I tested by running https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs/tree/v0.5.1/tests/plugins/http locally

OK, I will do this on agent side only. Thanks for you all.

@easonyipj Let me explain a little more about this

> Yes, just like our plugin e2e test https://github.com/SkyAPM/go2sky/blob/master/plugins/http/test/docker-compose.yml

The docker compose is using `ghcr.io/apache/skywalking-agent-test-tool/mock-collector` as the backend rather than OAP server to test. As a result, all MAL scripts are not going to be tested if you ref this case to test.

Mock collector focuses on testing the data agent reported, whether it matches the expectation, but not how they would be analyzed.

@kezhenxu94 As the PR of MAL and UI settings are going to be merged soon, I suppose. I want to discuss with you about how to add this as a part of showcase Currently, we have a complete distributed system for demonstrating tracing, logging collecting, agent metrics collecting. Should or should not we add an APISIX gateway between browser and `app server (NodeJS)` as a tier1 Gateway, which could both activate skywalking plugin for tracing and Prometheus plugin for this new Gateway monitoring. Do you have any suggestion?

> @kezhenxu94 As the PR of MAL and UI settings are going to be merged soon, I suppose. I want to discuss with you about how to add this as a part of showcase > > > > > > > > Currently, we have a complete distributed system for demonstrating tracing, logging collecting, agent metrics collecting. > > Should or should not we add an APISIX gateway between browser and `app server (NodeJS)` as a tier1 Gateway, which could both activate skywalking plugin for tracing and Prometheus plugin for this new Gateway monitoring. > > > > Do you have any suggestion? Yes I think it's a suitable case to add APISIX as a tier1 gateway as this is a typical usage of APISIX. Currently I'm using `npm start` to start the app(browser) and app(server), which is not a typical production deployment method, so we can set up APISIX as a static file server to serve the front end files AND proxy the app(server).
That seems good. @pg-yang Could you follow this way to build the showcase?
Others are good to me, wait for https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9725#discussion_r985197392 conclusion.

> 

OK, thanks very much, I will learn how to use these to build an e2e test.
Sure  , I need to understand showcase project first  , and would ask you if have trouble
Zhenxu built the current distributed system, he would be able to help you if needed.

```
# TYPE apisix_bandwidth counter
apisix_bandwidth{type="egress",route="routes#1",service="1",consumer="",node="172.18.0.3"} 27379040
apisix_bandwidth{type="ingress",route="routes#1",service="1",consumer="",node="172.18.0.3"} 12066880
```
Metrics with empty  route/node means don't match any router/node

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193535587-9cb1d4df-758b-4910-add3-3a273cce903e.png)

Above metrics (in  service level ) only display metrics which mismatch route/node ,  also means these metrics would be empty if apisix always could find an appropriate upstream/node . We could put these metrics as error metrics  in gateway level , such as 404, 502

Sorry

you could do 
1. Showing the no `route` as the `no route rule metrics`
2. Is there any real case about no `node`? That seems a bug rather than a metric.
3. You could aggregate all not-null route and node metrics as the global one.
In no `rule` case, latency should be `nano-sec` rather than traditional `ms`. `1ms` is too slow for a request w/o route rule, right?

:warning: **6 God Classes** were detected by Lift in this project. [Visit the Lift web console](https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/apache/skywalking/01GEEKQRCNEY2DK5CKTVBVN7E6?tab=technical-debt&utm_source=github.com&utm_campaign=lift-comment&utm_content=apache\%20skywalking) for more details.
@mrproliu As a protocol analyzer, I think it should be very easy to rebuild one, and we just need HTTP 1.1/2 identifying.

Another thing I found is that this file is not a simple copy of the original file. It adds some other content from other file but doesn't mention the changes and the other files. I'm not sure whether there are other similar cases or not. Please overhaul the licenses of files that are copied from other repos.

> * Is there any real case about no `node`? That seems a bug rather than a metric.

Not bug , APISIX prometheus doc show  the describe such as   `route_id of the matched Route with request. Defaults to an empty string if the Routes don't match.` .
Currently  only 404 in gateway level could  produce empty node/route , my local test data : 

```
apisix_bandwidth{type="egress",route="",service="",consumer="",node=""} 364000
apisix_bandwidth{type="egress",route="routes#1",service="1",consumer="",node="172.18.0.3"} 682000
apisix_bandwidth{type="egress",route="routes#3",service="3",consumer="",node=""} 764000
apisix_bandwidth{type="ingress",route="",service="",consumer="",node=""} 192000
apisix_bandwidth{type="ingress",route="routes#1",service="1",consumer="",node="172.18.0.3"} 386000
apisix_bandwidth{type="ingress",route="routes#3",service="3",consumer="",node=""} 192000
# HELP apisix_http_status HTTP status codes per service in APISIX
# TYPE apisix_http_status counter
apisix_http_status{code="404",route="",matched_uri="",matched_host="",service="",consumer="",node=""} 2000
apisix_http_status{code="404",route="routes#1",matched_uri="/service-a/*",matched_host="",service="1",consumer="",node="172.18.0.3"} 2000
apisix_http_status{code="500",route="routes#1",matched_uri="/service-a/*",matched_host="",service="1",consumer="",node="172.18.0.3"} 2000
apisix_http_status{code="503",route="routes#3",matched_uri="/service-c/*",matched_host="",service="3",consumer="",node=""} 2000
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193611196-1a089f52-b010-444f-8eb4-f02516ece2a9.png)
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917424/193610969-26a6714f-1d0f-44d6-a335-05bcaf98db06.png)

>  You could aggregate all not-null route and node metrics as the global one.

I  would  aggregate all metrics as global metrics , don't filter any tag . 

> Showing the no route as the no route rule metrics
In no rule case, latency should be nano-sec rather than traditional ms. 1ms is too slow for a request w/o route rule, right?

I would add a new metrics for displaying http status which request couldn't match any route , title is  `HTTP status (route mismatched)` . I think displaying  latency , bandwidth for invalid request is meaningless  , `HTTP status (route mismatched)` is enough to notice user

And  changing latency unit from ms to  nano-sec is not a good choice . because `OpenTelemetryMetricHandler` has already convert nano-sec to ms .

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/5ae4c125f8cbeb7c53fed4269ca110eeac9aa661/oap-server/server-receiver-plugin/otel-receiver-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/otel/otlp/OpenTelemetryMetricHandler.java#L172-L179

> Not bug , APISIX prometheus doc show the describe such as route_id of the matched Route with request. Defaults to an empty string if the Routes don't match. .

Then this should be `Not matched route trend`.

> I would aggregate all metrics as global metrics , don't filter any tag .

You should filter to separate valid request(having matched route) and invalid request

>I think displaying latency , bandwidth for invalid request is meaningless , HTTP status (route mismatched) is enough to notice user

Actually, they are meaning full. They could show whether there is a serious DDoS(or similar) attack. Bandwidth is a serious cost even with low request load, as well as latency because high latency would mean the CPU of APISIX would be cost and used for the meaningless requests. 

> And changing latency unit from ms to nano-sec is not a good choice . because OpenTelemetryMetricHandler have already convert nano-sec to ms .

But I guess it is a double, we are still safe to convert it back. We keep precision as integer, too quick response would always be **0**.

ACK , Let's  distinguish valid and invalid  request  for http status , latency , bandwidth  in service level .

> But I guess it is a double, we are still safe to convert it back. We keep precision as integer, too quick response would always be 0.

My fault , [OpenTelemetryMetricHandler.java](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/5ae4c125f8cbeb7c53fed4269ca110eeac9aa661/oap-server/server-receiver-plugin/otel-receiver-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/otel/otlp/OpenTelemetryMetricHandler.java) didn't change value .

And latency unit is ms , it's defined by apisix prometheus plugin , so we couldn't convert it   to  nano-sec  

```
# HELP apisix_http_latency HTTP request latency in milliseconds per service in APISIX
# TYPE apisix_http_latency histogram
apisix_http_latency_bucket{type="apisix",route="",service="",consumer="",node="",le="1"} 2000

```

> And latency unit is ms , it's defined by apisix prometheus plugin , so we couldn't convert it to nano-sec

OK, if that is from APISIX plugin, let's keep them as they are now.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

@kezhenxu94 
Currently , app-ui  and app-server in one docker image . I  need to split to two image .

image-1 contains app-server 
image-2   contains app-ui  and apisix gateway  simultaneously .  And apisix would proxy request to ui , app-server  . 

RIght ?

> @kezhenxu94 
> 
> Currently , app-ui  and app-server in one docker image . I  need to split to two image .
> 
> 
> 
> image-1 contains app-server 
> 
> image-2   contains app-ui  and apisix gateway  simultaneously .  And apisix would proxy request to ui , app-server  . 
> 
> 
> 
> RIght ? 

Yes.

> Could we got python application memory or CPU usage about this latest skywalking-pythonÔºü@eus-lwq

The feature is implemented and pending merge, will be released in the next version.
Meter APIs are implemented and merged, and PVM metrics are pending. Closing this issue as completed.

I just have replied to Apache security team, this should be protected by you.

Quoted again

> This is not a security issue.
We documented this very clearly, and we recommend users set up a
security gateway on their own.
https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/next/en/ui/readme/#login-and-authentication

Various team has different security policies.
Some systems are internal browser app, which don't need extra cost to do similar security authentication check.

As far as I understand, that endpoint should not be protected.

I am using https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js to report the traces - this libraray is intended to be bundled with the client and it is intended to set up a proxy to pass on the requests by that client to skywalking.

This has nothing relative about should or shouldn't. 
This is an open source project to adopt general usage.

Are there any security recommendations on how to use the JS client / expose the HTTP access of skywalking for the JS client? Is Skywalking even considered "safe" for usage in a public accessible project?

What do you want to protect? From our understanding, you could limit format, field value check, HTTPS protection, request frequency, etc.

Security is an endless topic. Those you prefer in general are also working for this case.

SkyWalking doesn't have point to rebuild those solutions.

I don't think you understand me.

So in short for anyone else reading here (since I believe this won't be fixed):

**WORKAROUND**

In the proxy that you have before the `/browser/perfData` endpoint of OAP, reject all requests that have a pagePath of "".

Created a PR to document this behavior in the client JS package.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js/pull/96

> Could you confirm what is your asking directly?

I am not asking anything. I just made the following assumptions
1. The [skywalking-client-js](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js) package is intended to be used by "normal" websites that are accessible to the public (or e.g. after a client registration, but any way, by clients that are outside the control of the server operator)
2. The endpoint `/browser/perfData` needs to be accessibly by that client (can be behind a https-proxy, but needs to be without authentication)-
3. Sending the data to that endpoint will make the UI not accessible any more

This is a Denail of Service / dara corruption by an unauthorized attacker. I don't see it as that relevant to security (just taking down some monitoring system), but it might even get a pretty high [CVE score](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln-metrics/cvss/v3-calculator?vector=AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:L&version=3.1)

See, you are back to another thing again.
I am not sure why you keep switching two things. The PR you created is not about these points at all.
This is a bad practice to discuss things like this.
